Articles.Content:
[URL="http://kerbalx.com/waterlubber/The-Kestrel.craft"]TL;DR Direct Link[/URL]

Every pilot wants a few things in a plane.
[LIST]
[*]Manoeuvrable
[*]Hard to stall
[*]Fuel economy
[*]Speed
[*]Cost
[*]Features!
[*]Aesthetics
[/LIST]

Unfortunately, at best, you can only have a few of these things. It's unheard of to have all of them.

Well, until now!

[img]http://i.imgur.com/PIFMjdC.jpg[/img]

[SIZE=3]Presenting: [SIZE=4]The Kestrel
[SIZE=1]a HCI Production

[SIZE=2]The Kestrel is an all-around great craft for a burgeoning space program. Available at the low, low price of 12,670 SpaceBucks, this plane won't put a dent in your budget, and Mortimer will be kept happy. Due to the rather low tech requirements, and excellent altitude range presented by the J-404 engine, this craft is well-suited to fulfilling contracts. It can hop over to the desert in less than 20 minutes (5 minutes in real life), and won't stall or bug out when warping. Fuel isn't much of an issue, either: You can achieve high speeds of 600 m/s without using the afterburner, for up to [B]two[/B] hours!

The craft is 100% stock. Here's some information:

Action Groups:
[/SIZE][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*][SIZE=2]Toggle J-404 Engine
[/SIZE]
[*][SIZE=2]Toggle afterburner
[/SIZE]
[*][SIZE=2]Engage front canard flaps
[/SIZE]
[*][SIZE=2]Engage rear elevator flaps[/SIZE]
[/LIST]
B. [SIZE=2]Engage wheel brakes and patented split-yaw airbrakes.
[/SIZE][SIZE=2]
How to SuperCruise[SUP]TM:[/SUP]
[LIST=1]
[*]Engage afterburner, and climb at supersonic speeds to 7,000 meters.
[*]Flatten out to 10 degrees pitch.
[*]While climbing to 10,000m, accelerate to approximately 500m/s.
[*]Continue accelerating until you reach 550m/s, then disengage afterburner.
[*]The engine will continue thrusting, and at 10km you will achieve sustained hypersonic speeds.
[/LIST]

Here is an album for your pleasure:
[imgur]XgDvl[/imgur]

[/SIZE]
